metadata.title: Narrative Digital Finance: a tale of structural breaks, bubbles & market narratives

questions.title: What data will you collect, observe, generate or reuse?
questions.original: We will use publicly available data on financial markets as well data from databases which we buy, e.g. from Refinitiv. The data will be in csv format, about 10 GB, the data type are financial data, stored as integers and characters.

enhanced.intro: We use publicly available data from financial markets (accessed via original source URLs) and commercial databases (accessed via provider APIs). Public data is not re-stored by us. Commercial data remains on provider infrastructure per license agreements. Only project-generated code and outputs are stored on GitHub.

commercial_sources.name: Refinitiv/LSEG
commercial_sources.description: Earnings call transcripts, financial news, market data

commercial_sources.name: Deutsche Borse T7
commercial_sources.description: Nanosecond-level trading data for FESX and DAX futures

enhanced.storage_note: Public data accessed via original URLs. Commercial data on provider servers. Code on GitHub.

questions.title: How will the data be collected, observed or generated?
questions.original:
Quality assurance
- The data are checked for consistency and completeness using statistical methods.
Versioning
- The code and the database are versioned with the help of the ZHAW internal tools.

The quality of the collected data will be checked during the first working package and is an integral part of the research. The consistency as well. In addition, due to shortcomings of the data, we will apply statistical methods to overcome this. We will have various documents describing the dataset, its quality and the methods used to check its consistency.

enhanced.quality_assurance: The data are checked for consistency and completeness using statistical methods. Automated validation scripts verify data integrity. Cross-validation with alternative data sources is performed where available.
enhanced.versioning: The code and the database are versioned with the help of Git. Code repositories are maintained on GitHub (Digital-AI-Finance organization). Data releases may receive DOIs via Zenodo integration.
enhanced.original_paragraph: The quality of the collected data will be checked during the first working package and is an integral part of the research. The consistency as well. In addition, due to shortcomings of the data, we will apply statistical methods to overcome this. We will have various documents describing the dataset, its quality and the methods used to check its consistency.
enhanced.collection_methods: API Access via FRED API (Python fredapi), SEC EDGAR XBRL API, and BIS web scraping (Beautiful Soup). Commercial data is accessed via RavenPack SQL access, LSEG API and bulk delivery, and Deutsche Borse secure file transfer. NLP Processing uses HuggingFace transformers, BERT/FinBERT embeddings, and BERTopic modeling.

questions.title: What documentation and metadata will you provide with the data?
questions.original: The information on the data as well as data sources and survey processes are documented in detail. The information on the project and the data will be made available to our university employees so that further projects can be developed in this area.

enhanced.original_paragraph: The information on the data as well as data sources and survey processes are documented in detail. The information on the project and the data will be made available to our university employees so that further projects can be developed in this area.
enhanced.metadata_standards: Standard README documentation with variable descriptions and usage instructions.
enhanced.documentation: Data Dictionaries contain variable names, types, and descriptions in README.md files. Code includes inline comments where helpful. Dependency files (requirements.txt) are provided where applicable.

questions.title: How will ethical issues be addressed and handled?
questions.original:
No personal data or other sensitive data is used in the project. In this respect, the university internal security standards are applied.

The conditions have already been discussed with the data providers. No special security standards are required by the data providers for this data.

enhanced.original_paragraph: No personal data or other sensitive data is used in the project. In this respect, the university internal security standards are applied. The conditions have already been discussed with the data providers. No special security standards are required by the data providers for this data.
enhanced.ethical_considerations: All financial data is aggregated market data with no individual identification. Central bank speeches are official public communications. Research outputs are intended for academic purposes.

data_provider_agreements.terms: Research collaboration agreement with Dr. Schlamp

enhanced.ethics_approval: Not required (non-human-subjects research per Swiss SNSF guidelines)

questions.title: How will data access and security be managed?
questions.original: Access to the data is only granted to team members. The university IT service guarantees the security of data and processes. No sensitive data or personal data is collected in the project.

enhanced.original_paragraph: Access to the data is only granted to team members. The university IT service guarantees the security of data and processes. No sensitive data or personal data is collected in the project.

access_control.storage: Original source URLs (not re-stored by us)

enhanced.security_measures: Commercial data remains on provider infrastructure per license agreements. Project code is public on GitHub.

questions.title: How will you handle copyright and Intellectual Property Rights issues?
questions.original: The project is based on data that are largely publicly available. The raw data records may not be published without restriction.

enhanced.original_paragraph: The project is based on data that are largely publicly available. The raw data records may not be published without restriction.

questions.title: How will your data be stored and backed-up during the research?
questions.original:
The storage capacities are very large, the amount of data remains very limited in the project.

The data is managed in the form of databases on the ZHAW internal Github. Backups and versions of the data are continuously created.

enhanced.original_paragraph: The storage capacities are very large, the amount of data remains very limited in the project. The data is managed in the form of databases on GitHub. Backups and versions of the data are continuously created.
enhanced.storage_rationale: Public data accessed via original URLs (not re-stored). Commercial data remains on provider servers (not redistributable). Only project code stored on GitHub.

questions.title: What is your data preservation plan?
questions.original: The data is stored on the ZHAW internal github for a long time and managed by the ZHAW using the existing tools. There is no obligation to destroy the data.

enhanced.original_paragraph: The data is stored on GitHub for a long time and managed using existing tools. There is no obligation to destroy the data.
enhanced.retention_period: As long as GitHub available. Note: Public data remains at original sources. Commercial data is provider responsibility.

questions.title: How and where will the data be shared?
questions.original: The code developed during the project together with all necessary accompanying documentation will be stored on a GitHub channel. On the other hand, the data archiving will be done through Zenodo. Zenodo offers safe storage for all data and research outputs in CERN's Data Centre and it provides easy integration with GitHub.

enhanced.original_paragraph: The code developed during the project together with all necessary accompanying documentation will be stored on a GitHub channel. On the other hand, the data archiving will be done through Zenodo. Zenodo offers safe storage for all data and research outputs in CERN's Data Centre and it provides easy integration with GitHub.

sharing_by_type.reason: Available at original sources - we do not re-distribute
License restrictions - remains on provider servers

questions.title: Are there any necessary limitations to protect sensitive data?
questions.original: We do not use sensitive data in the project. The data come from conventional data providers and are originally collected from public sources.

enhanced.original_paragraph: We do not use sensitive data in the project. The data come from conventional data providers and are originally collected from public sources.
what_we_do_not_store_or_share: Public data - available at original sources (FRED, BIS, SEC URLs provided)
Commercial data - remains on provider infrastructure per license agreements

questions.title: All digital repositories I will choose are conform to the FAIR Data Principles.
I will choose digital repositories maintained by a non-profit organisation.

enhanced.repository_note: GitHub is used for code storage. While GitHub (Microsoft) is not a non-profit, it is the standard platform for open-source code hosting. The project does not store research data that would require a non-profit repository - public data is accessed via original sources, commercial data remains with providers.
